channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Germany arrests woman who allegedly passed airport details to suspected spy for China
item.description: German authorities have arrested a Chinese national in Leipzig for allegedly passing sensitive information on a major air freight hub to a suspected Chinese spy. The accused, Yaqi X., reportedly shared details about military equipment and passenger transports linked to a German defense company.

item.title: 'Uncrewed surface vessel': Back-to-back attacks damage two ships off Yemen
item.description: A UK maritime agency reported a missile strike on a merchant vessel northwest of Yemen's Al Hudayah port, causing damage but leaving the crew unharmed. This incident follows a sea drone strike on another ship in the same region. Investigations are ongoing, and vessels are advised to exercise caution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tibetan group in India protests against China and human rights situation in homeland
item.description: Dozens of Tibetans in India staged a protest outside China's embassy against human rights abuses in Tibet. Police intervened, detaining some demonstrators. The Tibetan Youth Congress organized the protest, accusing China of cultural repression. The Dalai Lama and the Tibetan government-in-exile in Dharamshala continue to call for international support to safeguard Tibetan culture and autonomy.

item.title: Nato's longtime chief hands over to former Dutch premier Mark Rutte
item.description: Jens Stoltenberg steps down as Nato Secretary-General, succeeded by former Dutch PM Mark Rutte. Rutte prioritizes Nato's support for Ukraine, increasing defense spending, and strengthening partnerships. He emphasizes maintaining strong trans-Atlantic ties and expresses confidence in working with the future US administration. Stoltenberg praised Rutte's background for effective leadership.

item.title: China marks 75 years of Communist Party rule: Can Xi Jinping help avoid a Soviet-style collapse?
item.description: China's 75th anniversary of Communist rule was marked quietly amid fears of a Soviet-style collapse. President Xi Jinping emphasizes party loyalty and ideological discipline, wary of vulnerabilities like economic stagnation and public discontent. Xi’s focus on control and suppression highlights concerns over China’s economic future and the CCP's long-term stability.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Free today after years because ...': What Julian Assange said in his first public statement after release from prison
item.description: Julian Assange addressed the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, reflecting on his release from a British prison after serving five years. He admitted to charges under the Espionage Act, claiming his confinement was due to his journalistic activities in exposing classified US military misconduct.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Craters or sinkholes? Scientists investigate mysterious formations beneath lake Michigan
item.description: Scientists, using sonar technology, have discovered about 40 enormous craters ranging from 500 to 1,000 feet in diameter beneath Lake Michigan's surface. These formations, unveiled during a survey in 2024, are believed to be linked to gas or water upwelling and exhibit thriving aquatic life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Several feared dead in school bus fire in Thailand
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Thai farmer electrocutes over 100 endangered crocodiles on his farm; here's why
item.description: Thai crocodile farmer Natthapak Khumkad euthanized over 100 endangered Siamese crocodiles to prevent them from escaping into the community as Typhoon Yagi's relentless rains eroded their enclosure. The storm's severe impact compelled him to prioritize public safety, making a dire decision within 24 hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US port shutdowns: 45,000 dockworkers walk out over pay and automation
item.description: Dockworkers from Maine to Texas began striking over wages and automation, affecting 36 U.S. ports. The walkout, involving 45,000 International Longshoremen's Association members, follows their contract's expiration and seeks fair compensation and job protection. The strike risks supply chain disruptions and economic costs if it persists.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man treks for 11 miles to meet parents stranded after Hurricane Helene
item.description: Sam Perkins embarked on a perilous trek to reach his parents' isolated home in North Carolina after Hurricane Helene's devastation. Roads were blocked by landslides and flooding, forcing him to hike 11 miles. Upon arrival, he found his parents safe but isolated, urging community support post-emergency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Montana man sentenced to prison for breeding hybrid sheep using smuggled DNA
item.description: Arthur "Jack" Schubarth, 81, was sentenced to six months in prison for illegally breeding hybrid sheep with tissue from large sheep for trophy hunting. Judge Brian Morris stressed the need to deter genetic manipulation. Schubarth must pay fines, destroy hybrid sheep with Marco Polo DNA, and is prohibited from breeding game stock during his probation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Before and after pictures show harrowing impact of Hurricane Helene
item.description: Hurricane Helene has left southeastern US communities devastated, with North Carolina experiencing the highest casualties. Rescue teams struggle with power outages and blocked roads while searching for missing persons. President Biden will visit North Carolina as relief efforts face criticism for neglecting certain areas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California governor signs law banning voter ID requirements; 'Joker is in Charge', says Elon Musk
item.description: Elon Musk criticized California's new law banning local governments from requiring voter ID, expressing concerns about election security and voter fraud. His comments sparked mixed reactions on social media, highlighting a divide on the issue. The law was enacted following Huntington Beach's voter ID mandate and aims to counter conservative initiatives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYC's oldest lesbian bar sues 'angry woke' for $40 million over racism allegations
item.description: Henrietta Hudson, a historic lesbian bar in the US, has filed a $40 million lawsuit against activist Anne Marie Siroun Bompart, claiming her social media accusations of racism have damaged their reputation. The bar alleges Bompart's claims led to event cancellations and tarnished their long-standing community contributions. Bompart, facing bans from multiple bars, plans to represent herself in court.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Must level playing field': California bans legacy admissions in higher education institutions
item.description: California governor Gavin Newsom signed a bill banning legacy preferences in private college admissions, effective fall 2025. This law addresses equity in admissions and ensures compliance through annual reports. California joins Maryland in prohibiting legacy admissions at private, non-profit universities, reflecting public opinion against alumni influence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance draws comparison between 'abortion' and 'slavery' in controversial audio clip
item.description: Senator JD Vance's comparison of abortion to slavery has fueled criticism from reproductive rights advocates. During his campaign, Vance has promoted a nationwide abortion ban and voiced support for federal measures to limit access. Kamala Harris has strongly criticized Vance’s views and their potential implications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3 dead, 15 injured in Shanghai knife attack
item.description: In Shanghai, a knife attack at a supermarket resulted in three fatalities and 15 injuries. The attacker, a 37-year-old man named Lin, was detained. Recent incidents, including attacks in Shenzhen and Suzhou, have raised security concerns. Authorities frequently attribute such violence to mental illness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lines for fresh water, communities cut off: Hurricane Helene leaves trail of destruction with over 130 dead, many missing
item.description: Hurricane Helene has devastated the southern US, causing 133 deaths across six states, with 600 people still missing. Western North Carolina is particularly affected, suffering from severe floods, disrupted communication, and critical infrastructure damage. Emergency teams continue rescue operations, while aid delivery efforts have begun to support the hardest-hit regions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says he coordinated with Musk to deploy Starlink; White House counters
item.description: Former President Donald Trump claimed he coordinated with Elon Musk to deploy Starlink systems to hurricane-hit North Carolina, accusing the Biden administration of delays. The White House refuted this, affirming that deployment was already underway with 40 systems in use and 140 more on the way.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
